tv.generator-info-name: Original XML Generated with Tempest EPG Generator (made by Kvanc) - Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v0.9

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Jeannie has been searching for her brother since he was adopted and taken to Australia more than 50 years ago. Kirsty tells how she gave up her son for adoption when she was 15 and has struggled with the decision ever since.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Hannah meets conservationists and children saving endangered birds, Costa visits a stunning ornamental garden, Tammy crafts a bay leaf wreath, Jane visits an innovative small garden, and we meet a prolific bonsai artist.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: How influential was Charlie Kirk on the MAGA movement? Chas and John discuss Kirks controversial legacy, Americas deep divide and the political fallout. Plus Trumps bold plan to turbocharge his mass deportation machine.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: The leading news at lunchtime. Ros Childs brings you the days top stories and the latest news as it unfolds, with reporters in the community across Australia and around the world reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Rookie architect Nick is aiming to solve Australias housing crisis by showing that good design is affordable for everyone.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Amy Greenbank, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: In the Northern Ireland town of Ballymena locals are waging a war on migrants, attacking their homes and forcing them out of town. Its the worst violence in a wave of anti-immigration protests across the UK this summer.

programme.title: PNG: The Road To Independence
programme.desc: PNGs independence 50 years ago came against all odds. One of the most culturally diverse lands on earth, this is the story of the leaders who united tribes and the role of colonial Australia in the birth of a nation.

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: Former members of the group once known as Exclusive Brethren talk about the psychological manipulation, surveillance and threats the church allegedly uses against them, as well as attempts to intimidate and buy their silence.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Trouble in paradise: Tensions after Pacific journalists were excluded from the PMs presser. A US podcast outfit with truly a podcast for everyone. Plus Taliban tourism: influencers give Afghanistan an Instagram glow-up.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Jon and Noreen take on an epic self-build, creating a modern treehouse on a half-acre site in the heart of a Gloucestershire town.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Costa visits a community recovering from floods, Jane looks at new plant varieties, Tammy explores lush green walls, Millie plants long season crops, Sophie profiles fragrant flowers, and we meet a duo of daffodil lovers.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Wan Kantri: The Next 50 Years
programme.desc: Embark on a powerful journey into the heart of Papua New Guinea, 50 years on from independence. Wan Kantri captures the spirit and traditions of a country deeply connected to its roots and confidently looking to the future.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Trouble in paradise: Tensions after Pacific journalists were excluded from the PMs presser. A US podcast outfit with truly a podcast for everyone. Plus Taliban tourism: influencers give Afghanistan an Instagram glow-up.

programme.title: Anhs Brush With Fame
programme.desc: Dr Richard Harris is a medical hero. When a soccer team became trapped in a Thai cave in 2018, the South Australian anaesthetist played a pivotal role in getting them out. How will Anh portray his courageous spirit?

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: News from where we live. ABC News NSW brings you the days top stories, exclusive investigations and original reporting on the issues that matter to you. Presented by Amy Greenbank, plus weather with Tom Saunders.

programme.title: Hard Quiz
programme.desc: Four contestants vie for the Hard Quiz Big Brass Mug! Which topic will triumph: Peter Sellers, The Chats, beer... or will The Great Fire of London destroy them all? Play along at home!

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon, Lee Mack and David Mitchell return in an episode packed with some of the best bits from the series.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: How influential was Charlie Kirk on the MAGA movement? Chas and John discuss Kirks controversial legacy, Americas deep divide and the political fallout. Plus Trumps bold plan to turbocharge his mass deportation machine.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Its a-MAZE-ing! Theres a furry friend in the lab as the doctors reveal how your brains hippocampus works to create maps so you dont get lost.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Sallys family secrets are about to be revealed when her mum arrives at Malory Towers. Meanwhile, Darrells meddling causes problems for Miss Potts.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Its a normal day for the Bears. That means Ice gets in a fight with a Roomba, Pandas life gets turned upside down when a mouse invades his room, and Grizz gets stuck in a tree. You know, everyday stuff for a bear.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: A talented swimmer named Ondine gets akumatized into Syren. She has feelings for Kim and wants to turn Paris into an Underwater Kingdom for her prince. Will Ladybug and Cat Noir manage to turn the tide?

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Concert Catastrophe
programme.desc: Maudie is crushed when her tickets to a pop concert go missing, especially since it seems likely that she herself has misplaced them.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Shaun and cos hi-jinks with the rotary clothes line end up making the Farmers washing filthy - so the race is on to get it clean again before he finds out.

programme.title: Expedition With Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve joins forces with ropes expert Aldo Kane and Saudi Arabian geologists Mahmoud AlShanti and Hala Alwagdani - on a mission to explore an unmapped volcanic underworld in search of the longest lava tube in Arabia.

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Special: The Glitch That Got Gem
programme.desc: While playing Animal Crossing, Harry causes an in-game glitch that traps Gem outside of the level - and real life! Will Harry and Gem be able to fix the bug and return everything back to the way it was?

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits, and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: Grizz likes burritos. A lot. So much so that after a restaurant makes a Bear-Sized burrito, Grizz cant bring himself to eat such a majestic work of art. He carries the burrito everywhere.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: The sweet Miss Bustier gets akumatized into Zombizou. Armed with an evil black lipstick, she wants to spread love in the city... by force. Ladybug and Cat Noir cant get zombizoufied if they want to save Paris!

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Soccer Saga
programme.desc: Kyle asks Maudie and Ava to make a video of his soccer match but Maudie discovers something about the game is not quite right.

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmers tractor wont start, so when his back is turned Shaun and the flock decide to give it a quick make-over.

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Eddie and Emery are struggling to find the perfect gift for their mother, who feels that Santa could use some reinvention. Jessica and Louis convince Evan that Santa Claus is a scientist with multiple degrees from Princeton.

programme.title: Merlin
programme.sub-title: The Death Song Of Uther Pendragon
programme.desc: Arthur risks everything when he summons a spirit from the dead - Uther.

programme.title: Mythbusters: Theres Your Problem!
programme.desc: The mysterious world of animals is the focus of this episode, in which the MythBusters find out if elephants are afraid of mice; if bloodhounds can be thrown off the scent; and if bulls really are attracted to red.

programme.title: Changing Ends
programme.desc: Its BCG day at Alans school and he decides to pull a sickie. With Christine otherwise disposed its up to a begrudging Graham to play nursemaid.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Southgate is offered a position as principal in Yanderra and asks Yola to come with him. Meanwhile, Steve and Danielle decide to make a horror movie. (Final)

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When Marinette makes a serious mistake, she has to face the consequences by fighting the last person she ever imagined would get akumatized...

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Big Mouth Challenge
programme.desc: When Ben mounts a competition to see who can fit a very large biscuit in their mouth like he can, Maudie is suspicious.

programme.title: 100% Wolf: Legend Of The Moonstone
programme.desc: With both halves of the stone in Rics hands, Freddy must take on the mantle of Canis Rex and save his pack.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Twenty-Seven and Twenty-Eight explore the new Pattern Wall at the Gallery. Learn about the numbers 27 and 28 and explore number patterns with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Millie and the kids search for tree branches and build a cubby from the branches and string and then plant a simple, beautiful garden around it. They have a picnic out front.

programme.title: BTN
programme.desc: Victoria Treaty; Migration; Young Saint; Takeover Burnie - Lucus

programme.title: Sciencexplosion
programme.desc: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6! Did you know that not all bugs are insects, and that all insects have six legs? In this STEM episode Eric learns more about the bodies of these little creatures. Its not magic, its science!

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil Spencer advises on how to spruce up and sell a three-bedroom detached cottage on the outskirts of Manchester that has been on the market for a staggering four years with no offers.

programme.title: George Clarkes Old House New Home
programme.desc: George tackles two very different houses, both from his favourite architectural period, appropriately enough; Georgian. (Final)

programme.title: Austin
programme.desc: Austin invites Julian and Ingrid home to have lunch with his "embarrassing" family, while Ingrid contemplates some extra-marital wham wham.

programme.title: rage Vroom Vroom Special
programme.desc: From Jamiroquai, Gorillaz, M.I.A, David Hasslehoff and more, come jump in the rage automobile and jam out to the best music videos that feature the coolest whips around.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig looks into some origins and openings, with special guests Josh Widdicombe, Susan Calman, Rich Hall and Alan Davies. Tune in to hear what Mr First thought of Mr Second, and much more.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Everyone is left shocked when Sam Robinson returns to Hartley High to fill a new teaching role.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug and Cat Noir face Alya, Rose and Juleka, now the Punishers Trio, and Adriens cousin Felix.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Pestering Prank Caller
programme.desc: When a prank caller targets Ezra and his neighbours, Maudie believes the Inbestigators can track down who is making the mystery calls.

programme.title: My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic
programme.desc: Twilight and the rest of the Mane Six head to the Crystal Empire for the "Crystalling" of Cadence and Shining Armors new baby while Twilight takes the opportunity to present Starlight with her first friendship lesson.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Octonaughty returns with a whole new dimension of naughtiness. This calls for a whole new dimension of superhero! Learn about cubes, and other ways of arranging blocks in three dimensions with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the kids are inspired by nature to create a green space that is for relaxation, reflection and mindfulness. Its a place to breathe in nature and forget about your worries.

programme.title: Bitesize Daily
programme.desc: Connecting to our world, good friends help wellbeing, being a good friend.

programme.title: BTN Newsbreak
programme.desc: Find out whats going on in the world with a news bulletin designed for children, featuring stories that are relevant and easy to understand.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phils latest secret mission takes him to Dorking, where he finds a period property thats charming on the outside and a little bit alarming on the inside.

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: Zaf and Adam go undercover in an attempt to stop a terrorist bomb attack.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.desc: Tombliboo Eee becomes separated from the other two Tombliboos, Unn and Ooo.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: When the Sound Collector finds a studio, he remembers when he was in a band!

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Sula and Amma go round to Bings house to watch the fireworks. Sula doesnt like the bangs so shes wearing her earmuffs but Bing thinks hes brave enough to watch the fireworks outside in the garden.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are spending the day on the river with Granny and Grandpa Pig. Danny Dog is sailing too, with Granddad Dog. Grandpa Pig and Granddad Dog are best friends and race to see who has the fastest boat.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: The PJ Power Heroes are captured by the Gloopettes as Newton is forced to make Star Gloop

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben is in training for the elf games, Holly wants to join in but the rules state there is absolutely no flying or magic allowed. Ben gives Holly one last chance to join in without using her magic.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: During the renovation of Peppas home, they find out the construction crew used the robot house blueprint Peppa and George made! Thankfully, Peppa finds the original design to re-build the house into their perfect new home!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets attempt to train four young kids as Junior Junior Cadets - but their first lesson is a disaster!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.sub-title: The Lost And The Furry One
programme.desc: Lobo loses his favourite items while playing, but with Zoes remembering song and help from the Super Monsters, he learns to retrace his steps and finds everything!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley gets a call from Fifi, Fred and Little Woo asking him to help them film a song theyve just made up.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie is at school for art class, learning about coming up with ideas and how to turn a mistake into a masterpiece.

programme.title: Play School Show Time
programme.desc: This episode is such a spectacle you could hang it in a gallery! Join Rove McManus as he shows off his sketching skills and entertains us with a fun drawing game that brings a variety of silly situations to life!

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Captain Feathersword invites John, Tsehay, and Caterina to his Pirate Training Camp! Can they walk the plank and complete the challenge? Get ready to lift dumbbells and sing along to Big Strong John

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Beatboxing, rock, opera, disco: the Alphablocks sing their letter sounds freestyle from A to Z. This episode has fun with the whole alphabet and their letter sounds.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Madame Gazelle teaches the children how to play Bat and Ball, she teaches them so well that they beat her at the game and win!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes discover a new game - Pea-Rex Pinball! Its all fun and games until they suddenly find themselves cornered by a horde of super irritated Vegesaurs.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: When Tidbit gets dehydrated, Vida helps him find a way to play AND hydrate at the same time.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: The Town Hall clock has lost its Ding Dong. Myrtle relies on it to remind her to make important mayoral phone calls, Hattie to take her scones out of the oven so they dont burn, and Cynthia to start the train.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Octobella creates a powerful octopus crystal that makes her a bigger threat than ever.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets attempt to train four young kids as Junior Junior Cadets - but their first lesson is a disaster!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Yong Bao tells Thomas the story of how he came to have a magnificent tiger emblem on his tender.

programme.title: Reef School
programme.desc: Its the last day of Reef School! Ahead of their holiday adventures, the Reefies hear about Sally the zebra sharks awesome travels and the familiar face she unexpectedly encountered along the way.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds spot a storm coming! They find out how to spot the signs, explore different types of storms, and watch as thunder, lightning, and rain become sunshine and a rainbow.

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Missing Crystal Pinecone
programme.desc: Izzy and Timmy try to dig up treasure at the top of Lawrence Pinecones Statues shadow. The Mechas help when they find nothings there!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey and Bingo would rather explore their holiday hotel room than relax on the beach.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Valentines Day! Daddy Pig gives Mummy Pig a card, but Mummys card to Daddy hasnt arrived. Everyone is sad that Daddy didnt get a card. But when the post finally arrives, theres a big surprise.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: Is there a monster in Lake Swoppiton? Mojo and Bo help Bryan be brave to find out!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: While trying to help Dashi on her missions, Pesos little brother, Pinto, gets himself in trouble with a bombardier beetle and a steaming-hot geyser.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: On a trip to the beach, Mum teaches Bluey to throw, while Bingo and Dad get creative with a funny shaped stick.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggees workshop needs cleaning, so the squirrels try to help him - but they end up building a maze around Duggee!

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertatos dancing is too powerful and destructive, but when he has to face Evil Pea in a dance-off to save his trapped friends, he soon realises his moves can save the day.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Blueys having fun copying everything Dad says and does, but the game takes a serious turn when Bluey finds a hurt budgie and they have to make an emergency trip to the vet.

programme.title: In The Night Garden
programme.sub-title: Ssh! Upsy Daisys Having A Rest!
programme.desc: Upsy Daisy simply wants to rest in her bed but is disturbed by one character after another.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: Is it too late for the Sound Collector to see the Seed Collector before winter?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing plays with a new orange balloon but when he bounces on it too enthusiastically, it pops!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: George sits in the trolley in the supermarket while Peppa finds the things on Mummys shopping list. Soon, they have everything they need, as well as something that wasnt on the list - a delicious chocolate cake.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Gloop the Third is on his way to invade Earth, while the PJ Masks try to find a way to escape the Planet Gloop in order to stop him.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Nanny Plum is teaching the fairy girls some important fairy rules when she is blown away, trapped in a tree, dropped in a stream and covered in mud. Ben, Holly and Gaston the Ladybird come to her rescue.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are shocked to find their new bedrooms empty! Mummy and Daddy Pig tell them they will be the ones decorate their rooms, so they all go to a furniture shop to create the best rooms ever!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets are planning an epic surprise pool party for Phillipas birthday but when things get out of hand, they forget the golden pool rule: keep the gate shut.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Katya struggles to choose the perfect fruit punch for the Blue Moon party, but with her friends help, she creates a magical drink that everyone loves.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Stanley and the children make a museum exhibit about their home and friends.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie plays a board game with best friends Nina and Akil, learning how to deal with feelings of impatience, winning and losing.

programme.title: Play School Show Time
programme.desc: Strum and hum along with Josh Pyke on the ukulele as he visits the elephants, monkeys and koalas at the Play School Zoo in his whimsical rendition of Going To The Zoo.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: A techno dance party to remember! The Wiggles are planning a surprise birthday party for Dorothy the Dinosaur, filled with all of her favourite things.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Singing the alphabet song should be as easy as A, B, C for the Alphablocks, shouldnt it? This episode has fun with the whole alphabet and their letter names.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Its Valentines Day! Daddy Pig gives Mummy Pig a card, but Mummys card to Daddy hasnt arrived. Everyone is sad that Daddy didnt get a card. But when the post finally arrives, theres a big surprise.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes search for honeysuckles, leaving behind a trail of berries to help find their way back. But when Wasabi eats the trail, theyre stranded in the dark!

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Otto keeps getting a cramp while teaching dance class, so Vida teaches him to stretch!

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Little Woo would like Stanley to help them find more noisy things in the museum. Firstly, they go through the other exhibits to see what can go in their new noisy exhibition.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Night Ninja kidnaps An Yu and takes over mystery Mountain. Teent tries to save the day, but his anger keeps getting in the way.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets are planning an epic surprise pool party for Phillipas birthday but when things get out of hand, they forget the golden pool rule: keep the gate shut.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gordon and Rebecca do the same work - but they go about it differently. When Rebecca tries to be more like Gordon, it doesnt go well... for Gordon!

programme.title: Reef School
programme.desc: When Mr Flip takes the Reefies on an excursion to explore an underwater shipwreck, Ray goes missing and the excursion quickly turns into a search for a missing stingray.

programme.title: Ready, Steady, Wiggle!
programme.desc: Lachy and Simon join The Wiggles for story time, they tell the best stories and love making people laugh, but something is different this time. The reactions theyre getting are not what they expected!

programme.title: Mecha Builders
programme.desc: The "Pretty Big Thing" is scaring people from going to work. The Mechas must find out what it is!

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: On a trip to the beach, Mum teaches Bluey to throw, while Bingo and Dad get creative with a funny shaped stick.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her friends come to school early to have breakfast together. At the breakfast club, they learn about how food gives you energy and talk about their favourite breakfast foods.

programme.title: Mojo Swoptops
programme.desc: How do you stop a runaway rolling ferris wheel? Mojo and Bo need to figure it out fast!

programme.title: Octonauts: Above And Beyond
programme.desc: The Octonauts test drive the brand new Terra-Gup 2, a pangolin-inspired, armored gup, while rescuing creatures from a rockslide in the Rocky Mountains.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey wants to know why Dad is always bossing her around.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: When Duggees flowers look very sad, everyone does a rain dance to help make it rain.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Banana Superstars show is stopped when Evil Pea steals his peel. Supertato races against him to get it back, but trouble hits when a giant banana statue collapses onto the stage.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: A sleepover with their cousin means Bluey and Bingo get to stay up late! But when Muffin shows up exhausted after missing her nap, the girls get more fun than they bargained for.

programme.title: Long Lost Family

programme.desc: How influential was Charlie Kirk on the MAGA movement? Chas and John discuss Kirks controversial legacy, Americas deep divide and the political fallout. Plus Trumps bold plan to turbocharge his mass deportation machine.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: Foreign Correspondent
programme.desc: In rural China, a strict one-child policy saw many girls abandoned by their parents who only wanted boys. Many of these unwanted girls were given away to foster families who raised them to be future wives for their sons.
